items.content:
About Us

We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes across and instantly order custom parts.

We make custom manufacturing really easy!

We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros , stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems.

You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business.

When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 25 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks.
Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace.

Who are we looking for?

We're looking for a talented, and highly-motivated Head of Engineering / CTO (Hands On) to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our platform to enable us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with taking ownership of [and managing] all aspects of the stack.

Key Responsibilities

• Passion and proven track record of shipping high quality web and software based projects
• Ownership of projects, issues and their resolution
• Communication of ideas, planning and progress to the rest of the team

What technologies are involved?

Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform.

Key Requirements
1.) Thorough knowledge of C++, Python, R
2.) Experience Building with Microservices Architecture
3.) Well versed using Django / node.js
4.) Experience working with Agile principals

Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;
• JVM languages such as Java, Scala and Kotlin
• Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering knowledge
• CNC machining/Injection Moulding
• CAD/CAM software development
• Geometric computational analysis
• 3D Modelling
• NURBS Modelling
• PHP, CSS, JavaScript and HTML

If you are,
1. open to an exciting challenge,
2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and
3. believe you have what it takes - apply now!
Full time salary circa £50-70k depending on experience + Share Options

Benefits
• Free in-office 3D printing!
• Tasty snacks & treats
• An extra day off for your birthday
• Ability to work from home
• Competitive pay
• Generous Holiday
• A sociable team with weekly office events
• Prime location in Silicon Roundabout
• We get to work with the most innovative designers every single day!

items.title: Social Media Director
items.content:
WE ARE LOOKING FOR A NEW BRAW BLOGGER!

Interested in Events, brands, media, marketing? We are looking for someone to take over our social media platforms and be part of our awesome little team.

Unfortunately it's unpaid, however, we have some amazing benefits, fun and crazy unique events, great opportunity to grab those connections and gain further knowledge in the events industry!

Its flexible, work remotely and now and again grab a cheeky drink!

INTERESTED? Give us a shout at info@brawbloggerevents.co.uk



A little about us!

Braw Blogger Events started because Edinburgh is defined as an international city, where small businesses and bloggers don’t yet have an opportunity to connect & network. There is a perceived lack of awarenesses in the power of blogging and there are opportunities for businesses to hugely benefit.

We identified that the city holds a high proportion of independent bloggers and small businesses who want to expand and grow as well as gain knowledge and insights into what happens behind the screen. This proposes a huge opportunity as networking provides knowledge exchange, something that bloggers and businesses covet.
BBE is therefore distinguished from other events as it aims to connect people from different environments but with similar interests.

This will help business marketing, help bloggers find their niche whilst providing connections, allowing brands to promote and sell their products. There will be potential career opportunities, as well as further promotion and understanding of independent and larger companies.

With the fantastic success of the Edinburgh Blogger Conference on the 17th of June 2017. Bringing all areas and different niches together, we have branched and decided to follow up events throughout the year. With a fantastic fun list all throughout 2018!

From networking events, gatherings and workshops.
But we bring the fun into these motivational and exciting days! We aren't an ordinary conference/event team! That's for sure!

items.title: Vortala Pty Ltd: Website Account Manager
items.content:
Website Account Manager

Posted May 18

Vortala Pty Ltd
Headquarters: Australia
https://www.vortala.com/website-account-manager/
View all Vortala Pty Ltd jobs →

ExpandingDigital Media Company
Telecommuting (Virtual) Role

Foundedin 2004, Vortala serves the healthcare community by developing interactivewebsites that generate new patients and educate current patients.


Today,thousands of doctors worldwide trust Vortala to manage their practice websiteand online reputation.


Watch this short video tosee exactly how our website and online marketing service works!

Asan Account Manager, you’ll lead our North American clients to create highperforming practice websites. You’ll also manage a portfolio of existing clientwebsites by making website edits, answering client questions and providingguidance on maximizing clients’ online marketing efforts.


Yourjob responsibilities will include:

  • Account Management for new and live clients. This includes client liaison, website updates, troubleshooting issues and advising on new digital marketing methods to maximize site performance.

  • Working with new clients to build their practice website. The process starts with a doctor interview where you’ll harvest information for our writing team to craft engaging website content. Then you’ll liaise with our development, design and SEO teams to build the site.

To secure an interview, youshould demonstrate:

  • Superior written and verbal communication skills

  • Direct client service experience (via phone and email) and a passion for providing exceptional service

  • Proven experience with website content management

  • Basic html skills

  • Basic digital marketing skills (including SEO and social media)

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills

Theheart and soul of the role is to be technically adept, super-organized andmanage client expectations.


Ourculture revolves around our three core values of: Trust, Service andInnovation. All 60+ team members work from their own home office somewhere inthe world.


If you’re looking for a new career challenge with a high tempo team committed to service excellence, please apply today!

 


Apply for this position

Apply Here http://vortala.formstack.com/forms/website_account_manager_may_2018

items.content:
VP of Engineering

Posted May 17

Oddball
Headquarters: Remote
https://oddball.io/jobs

Oddball is seeking to add a VP of Engineering to our mighty team to help us scale and build out our engineering capabilities in our federal practice. The VP of Engineering will be the primary individual responsible for ensuring high-quality engineering in federal projects at Oddball.

The VP of Engineering is responsible for the following:

  • Establishing the career paths for the engineering practice area. This includes setting expected skill levels, setting the number of “rungs” on the career ladder, and establishing mentoring capabilities within the company
  • Architecting solutions that are valuable  and used across multiple programs
  • Guiding program teams to adopt consistent solutions to engineering and technical problems, and encouraging technical consistency across programs
  • Overseeing the screening process for all engineering candidates
  • Determining engineers’ eligibility for rotation and promotion
  • Providing technical oversight of all programs
  • Supporting and guiding team leads in both managerial and technical aspects
  • Publishing or organizing content that communicates Oddball’s engineering achievements and processes
  • Building programs to train and assess growing engineers
  • Implementing agile and working with client’s to do so.
  • Building technical strategies and assessing tech opportunities that can help us increase our performance
  • Building multiple software development lifecycles for client needs
  • Influencing and driving change with federal clients

The VP of Engineering is accountable for the following

  • Engineering screening process
  • Engineering mentorship program
  • Determining promotion eligibility
  • Determining team composition and assignment
  • Technical lead performance

Our ideal candidate would have experience being part of an ATO process at the federal level.
The VP of Engineering would also have experience managing devops transformations and cloud migrations.


Apply for this position

items.title: Head of People Operations
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
Europe

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Semaphore CI; 25-50 employees; 25-50% remote;

Rendered Text, the company behind SemaphoreCI.com, is looking for an experienced HR professional to join the team as Head of People Operations.

The moment

It's an exciting time to join the company as we're in a transition from office-based to a fully remote work environment. At the moment a third of us are working remotely from 7 countries. By the end of the year we expect more than half of our team to be globally distributed. As our first Head of People Ops, you'll be taking over the functions which have been performed by cofounders and recruiting manager.

About us

We're a bootstrapped company making Semaphore, a code delivery solution used by thousands of tech companies across the globe. Our mission is to help developers move fast in their work. We do that by delivering a product that's fast and easy to use, backed by a highly rated customer service.

Our culture is built on optimizing for happiness, of our customers and ourselves. We operate on continuous improvement on a personal and collective level. When doing things, we prefer to get real and make something valuable sooner, rather than never. We treat each other and our customers with openness, respect and empathy.

We started the company in 2009, and we're in the business for the long term. We prefer to work in an environment supported by self-made growth over VC-backed blitz-scaling.

REQUIREMENTS
The role

You’ll be responsible for people development programs, employee experience, and people operations.

Your work will ensure that Rendered Text is always an environment in which smart, ambitious people can do their best work and grow professionally.

To be successful you'll need to get fully integrated with our team and culture. You'll begin by understanding our current team structure and the business as a whole.

This position requires excellent leadership skills and proven ability to motivate team members, increase productivity, and grow overall happiness. It's a hands-on role. Over time, we expect you to lead a team.


Because of time overlap with the team, we'll consider candidates based in Europe only.


What you'll do

People development

- Actively contribute to our culture of learning and continuous development
= Identify individual learning needs for both team members and managers and provide solutions
- Build a performance management, talent development, and growth processes/programs

Employee experience

- Help maintain healthy work atmosphere and find ways to ensure a great employee experience every day
- Establish and manage processes to promote internal employee communication and facilitate information flow
- Act as an ambassador of Rendered Text to new hires and existing team members in all forms of communication
- Manage engagement surveys
- Perform ongoing coaching and counsel to managers related to employee concerns, company programs, development, etc.
- Contribute and help maintain our company playbook which codifies our values and processes

People operations

- Produce regular reports on all ongoing activities
- Manage employee data within HR-related systems
- Partner with executives and functional leaders to manage workforce, succession and compensation planning
- Interview all short-listed job candidates
- Lead employee on-boarding and off-boarding logistics
- Manage legal logistics of HR-related matters globally (with aid of outside counsel, as needed)

Requirements

5+ years of HR experience
Proven track record in an HR leadership role, preferably in a growth-stage company
Tech industry experience is a huge plus
Bachelors degree
High EQ and effective communicator
Excellent interpersonal skills
Self-managed and well organized
Ability to balance strategic thinking with hands-on work
Experience in working remotely
Excellent writing skills


BENEFITS
The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
Join a small team of around 20 full-time people who love what they do.
A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment.
Competitive salary.
Company retreats.
Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job.
Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice.

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

items.content:
Salary up to £45k OTE

Petspyjamas is the number one go-to for dog-friendly travel and growth has been rapid since we launched in 2012.

In this newly created role we are looking for a tenacious sales person to focus on maximising revenue opportunities with relevant third parties who have an interest in being visible to our high value, dog-adoring audience. This will be achieved through campaigns and promotions on our high traffic website, consumer email programmes as well as ad hoc on and offline promotional material.

This role is all about targeting opportunities/brands in adjacent sectors who can benefit from exposure to our audience. You will be generating new business from a standing start but the good news is that PetsPyjamas, as a brand, is becoming increasingly well known and it’s easy to demonstrate with data just how high value our customer base is. It’s all about being innovative, collaborative and making connections so that the advertiser is achieving their objective and our precious audience are learning something new/receiving an offer. Ideally both!

Roles and Responsibilities:

- Working closely with the founder on opportunities with third parties
- Work over phone, email and face to face to create deals & packages for clients (you really need to consider the ‘phone to be your greatest friend and enabler and
relish being on it and speaking to people!)
- You will love researching, contacting and speaking to new people to tell our story, mainly by telephone, so you’ve got to love it!
- Identify, categorise and develop an active contact strategy to build close relationships
- Work closely with creative team to deliver client campaigns

Working to monthly revenue targets

- Collaborate with Marketing team to coincide campaigns with our own content & marketing plan
- Collaborate with Marketing Manager on cross-over partnerships

Experience and skills required for this role:

- At least 2 years experience in a similar, new business role, ideally with contacts in consumer, lifestyle & FMCG brands aligned to Pets & Travel
- Excellent sales, communication & presentation skills - phone, email & face to face
- Entrepreneurial & creative mindset, always looking for new opportunities
- You will love researching, contacting and speaking to new people to tell our story
- Exceptional organisational skills
- Innovative, cutting edge and up to date with current marketing & advertising trends
- Ability to work to tight deadlines with a track record of meeting KPI’s and exceeding targets
- Highly self motivated, goal driven individual
- Good at building strong relationships, quickly, both in company and with brand new potential advertisers
- Competence using contacts management systems like HiRise
- Extremely passionate and eager to succeed

A real self starter who is happy to work in a team of one although we are a very close knit, collaborative team overall

The people we love and who love us:

--- Have a hands-on approach and are fast learners who love thinking on their feet
--- Are flexible in approach and always go the extra mile
--- Thrive on independence but adore collaboration
--- Have tons of energy, enthusiasm and a ‘can do’ attitude – we break down walls!
--- Love our brand and what pets bring to the world!

PetsPyjamas Perks:

--- A truly exciting environment where you have an opportunity to make your mark
--- Opportunities to develop and grow and be mentored by some of the best in the business
--- Cool work space, great Shoreditch location
--- One flexi-hour per week, come in early or late
--- Bring your dog to work!
--- Fresh Fruit deliveries
--- Lots of team social including Prosecco Fridays

items.content:
mHealth Software Sales Executive (100% Commission) at Delve Health

Minneapolis, Remote · Cofounder
Skills

Compensation
$120K–$200K
No Equity

Not available

Job Description

Delve Health is a software development “start-up” company headquartered in Minneapolis, MN. We are currently launching a new Clinical Trial collaboration platform (powered by a mobile application) designed to connect the Sponsor, Investigator and Patient called StudyPal.

We need to complete a 90-day demo "blitz" - focused exclusively on Medical Device manufacturers (public/ private) who execute multiple clinical trials per year.

Do you have standing relationships with medical device manufacturers?
Do you have experience selling software solutions to Medical Device manufacturers?
Are you able to schedule a StudyPal "demo" with Clinical Trial Managers, Clinical Operations, VP – Operations or Marketing Managers or related areas?
If you answered "yes" to any of these questions...you could make some serious coin!

Quota - Commission - Bonus:

StudyPal is sold in a license “bundle” costing $24,950 (this is our minimum sale):

Individual sales goal is $200,000 during 90-day demo "blitz." (roughly 8 sales)
$100 per "qualified" StudyPal demo scheduled & executed
10% on first $75k of revenue (tier 1)
15% on second $75k of revenue (tier 2)
20% of all revenue achieved after $150k
plus, an additional $10,000 bonus to any rep exceeding $300k of revenue in 90 days!
This is a ground floor opportunity.

100% commission based contract positions - see structure in posting below
Short-term delivery targets
Team members will operate virtually, with weekly video conference meetings with VP – Sales & CEO
Successful candidates will be well positioned for full-time positions and equity participation
Product Offering: StudyPal is a mobile collaboration software platform designed to improve communication between Clinical Trial participants (Sponsor, Investigators & Patients). The solution is NOT a Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS) or Electric Data Capture (EDC) solution. Value proposition;

Sponsor : Mobile, Collaboration, Analytics, Reduce Study Costs, Auditable, Study Work Flow, Accurate, Multi-language
Investigator : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Patient Enrollment, Patient Randomization, Easy, Educational, Auditable
Patient : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Simple, Empowering & Educational
Training and Preparation: Delve Health will provide you with a web demo of the StudyPal platform and answer any questions so you will be able to make a proper pitch. We will also provide ongoing support, and closing resources to ensure the offering has been properly framed for the need.

Primary Function: Operate as part of a team for marketing, promoting and profitably selling products and services to new customers.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Seeks out prospective customers/business opportunities with new customers.
Work as a sales team member to develop a marketing strategy and plan.
Collaboratively develop and maintain a sales forecast to help analyze market conditions for maximum productivity and sales growth.
Implement individual sales plan to support sales and profitability goals.
Generate profitable sales orders.
Work remotely while maintaining a high degree of collaboration.
Makes personal sales calls.
Follow-up on all generated quotations to assure that the customer is being serviced and to document the outcome of the proposed solution.
Report competitive conditions and feedback from customers to management.
Execute sales efforts in an ethical and professional manner, assuring a favorable impression of self and the company.
Maintains a professional/working image

Proven record of business development and sales within Medical Device verticle.

items.title: New Business Development Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
LOCATION: London (Plumen Head Office)
SALARY: £24k-£28k base + bonus (based on experience)
REPORTS TO: Head of Sales

THE COMPANY
Plumen makes the 21stCentury’s most iconic light bulbs and is the world’s first premium light bulb brand.

We put the magic back in the light bulb, creating superior light experiences by exploring new technology and stretching the limits of what’s possible.

We believe that making beautiful light bulbs is the best way to convert people to energy efficient technology and drive ‘real world’ sustainability.

Plumen has won some of the industry’s biggest awards, enjoyed huge press coverage and sold globally, but we are still a ‘start-up’. We’re a small, passionate team, working to tight budgets and big visions. If you’re looking to work hard, learn and make your mark then get in touch.

THE ROLE
We have great products and a great brand, but our goal now is to rapidly expand our distribution network globally in the same way we have in the UK.

The New Business Development Manager will lead the line for Plumen; you will be our ‘opener’, tasked with getting brand new accounts on board for Plumen.

The focus of the role will be to target our major European target markets in the UK, France and Germany. Regular visits to these markets will also be key to success in the role as you build up strong working relationships with our trading partners.

As opening up new relationships with new partners will be key to success, the administrative elements of account management will be largely handled by a supporting team, leaving the New Business Development Manager free to use more time building up relationship with new accounts.

THE DAY-TO-DAY
Opening up new accounts and pitching them the Plumen concept
Getting out to face-to-face meetings, leading product demonstrations and presentations to wow new partners
Building a pipeline of target accounts, across multiple sales channels, prioritising those that have scale and are a good fit for Plumen
Finding the key decision makers in these accounts, enabling us to get decisions made quickly and efficiently
Hitting core KPI of getting new accounts to purchase
Once a new account is opened, transitioning the account to our team of Account Managers who will oversee the administrative elements
Visiting major European trade shows
Developing a deep understanding of the big-name players in the European lighting market and networking with these top lighting partners
Using input from new accounts to guide Sales Channel Strategy and Product Development Strategy
Highlighting to the team on what the key barriers for new accounts are and what materials are needed to sell Plumen

ABOUT YOU
1-4 years’ experience in sales
A proven track record of business acquisition and development
Passion, passion, passion! We want someone who can fit in with the vibrant team we are building at Plumen where our energy is limitless!
A confident communicator with good written and oral communication skills
Clear understanding of Plumen’s unique points of difference vs key competitors
A hustler; always able find a solution even when the odds are stacked against you
Comfortable with start-up life (and preferably experience of it). That means energy, initiative, doing what’s required to get the job done, dedication, understanding and a sense of humour
If you think you’re up to the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

Please send us a short covering letter outlining your motivations and why you think you’d be good for the role!

You may also work as: Sales Executive, National Account Manager, Business Development Manager or similar

PHP/JS Developer

Posted May 8

Project Ricochet
Headquarters: Walnut Creek, CA
https://projectricochet.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=9
View all Project Ricochet jobs →

Project Ricochet has its hands in a lot of cool stuff. We are a completely distributed digital agency with a focus on PHP and Node.js. Currently, a large percentage of our work is in Drupal, but when we look to the future of the web, it’s in slick Javascript frameworks that bring the web alive and make it feel more and more like a native app.

We are in need of another developer to join our solid team and we’re taking our time to ensure that the candidate is the right fit.

As a distributed team, each team member is expected to be effective working remotely, either in a distraction-free home office or coworking space. The ideal candidate is also an experienced Drupal engineer who’s savvy in front-end and back-end aspects of Drupal (including theming, jQuery, & compiled css), has played around with Node.js and/or Angular.js - and has been looking for an opportunity to work with it more. Experience with both Drupal and Meteor.js are major pluses. 

Ricochet Team members are tasked with regularly exploring & playing with new technologies so that we can always stay on the cutting edge of technology. 

We offer competitive pay and a competitive bonus program based on your billable time.

Qualities of the Ideal Candidate

  • Solid capabilities in PHP (OOP and MVC Principles), HTML/CSS, Javascript (JQuery, Node.js or Meteor) and AJAX. Linux admin capabilities is a huge plus. As is knowing Drupal.

  • 3-5 years of experience with advanced Drupal development.

  • Computer Science degree or comparable solid knowledge and real world programming experience is a plus.

  • Humble, honest, hungry and smart.

  • Organized, systematic, and logical.

  • Good verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability to work in a team and grow from constructive feedback.

  • Has contributed to at least one Open Source project.

Challenges of the Job

  • You will be asked to learn constantly. Although support will be provided by our team, you need to research solutions and read documentation to find solutions on your own.

  • You must have the ability to multi-task and switch gears to work on multiple projects in any given day.

  • You must use our software to track your time and log your progress throughout the day.

  • You must be a fast, efficient and high-quality worker.

  • You must complete projects on budget (which you help set) and are expected to be billable at least 35 hours per week (in line with an industry standard 90%), extra billable hours or an advancement/increase of your billable rate will result in hourly bonuses paid quarterly.

Benefits of the Job

  • Work from home or the coworking space of your choice

  • Gain experience in a wide range of technologies and programming processes to acquire the competencies needed to be a rock-solid software developer.

  • Grow professionally and (most likely) personally in this role.

  • Regular 40 hour work week (overtime may be required from time to time but it is rare) and respectful, fun and relaxed work environment. We want you to have a good work/life balance and we also want to support you in any side projects you may be involved in.

  • Opportunities to be involved in entrepreneurial offshoots from products we develop internally.

Compensation

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience

  • Bonuses for extra billable hours allow you to easily make more than your salary, whenever you want.
  • Great opportunities for rapid advancement and sharing in our success.

  • For full-time employees: Healthcare, Major Holidays and Paid Vacation.

Apply for this position

Apply at https://projectricochet.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=9

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Information Technology, IT Security, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Auth0 provides a secure, highly available, enterprise-grade platform that secures billions of log-ins every year. The company makes it easy to implement even the most complex identity solutions for their web, mobile, IoT and internal applications, as well as sophisticated identity management for employees, customers and partners. Auth0 has raised over $54 million from Meritech Capital, NTT DoCoMo, Trinity Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners, K9 Ventures, Silicon Valley Bank, Founders Co-Op, Portland Seed Fund and NXTP Labs.

Thousands of enterprises and millions of users worldwide depend on Auth0 for authentication and authorization of their most mission-critical apps, APIs and IoT devices. Auth0’s top priorities are availability and security.

The Infrastructure Security team builds, owns and maintains the critical security infrastructure that provides visibility into Auth0’s production operations. We are looking for a Security Engineering Manager who is passionate about people and can lead them to deliver world class security infrastructure.

This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and this role is an opportunity to drive the expansion of our Security Operations team.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of Security Engineers to deliver great security infrastructure
  • Mentor and coach the engineers to keep them challenged and delivering their best work
  • Build processes and frameworks for Security Engineering and Security Operations
  • Build a diverse team - fostering a collaborative and an inclusive environment
  • Develop a roadmap for future work and be accountable for it's delivery
  • Build a metrics program
  • Develop strong relationship with our internal
  • Engineering teams; influencing their roadmaps and understand where we need to fill any gaps

Requirements:

  • Several years experience in an security engineering management role or a senior engineering team lead role
  • Experience working as a Security Engineer and delivering engineering projects
  • Experience hiring and attracting talented Engineers
  • You have enough technical expertise to drive to engineering and architecture decisions to:
    • Design, build and maintain the systems that help keep Auth0 secure
    • Develop tools to test, monitor and enforce security policy
    • Automate security process to reduce as much manual process
    • Own and improve our security monitoring pipeline
  • Experience administering and securing AWS Strong Linux experience
  • Experience with log collection and storage (e.g. ELK/EFK stacks, Sumo Logic etc)
  • Great organisational and project management skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills Comfort managing a remote, globally distributed team

Extra Points:

  • Exposure to agile release processes and supporting tools and infrastructure
  • A passion for infrastructure as code and have used tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Node, Go etc.)

Examples of our Engineering Culture:

  • https://auth0.engineering/
  • https://auth0.engineering/cloud-security-monitoring-at-auth0-part-ii-b106354a0e5d
  • https://auth0.engineering/detecting-secrets-in-source-code-bd63b0fe4921

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

About Auth0

Auth0 provides an enterprise-grade platform that secures billions of log-ins every year. The company makes it easy to implement even the most complex identity solutions for their web, mobile, IoT and internal applications, as well as sophisticated identity management for employees, customers and partners. Thousands of enterprises and millions of users worldwide depend on Auth0 for authentication and authorization of their most mission-critical apps, APIs and IoT devices. Auth0’s top priorities are availability and security.

Competitive Equity
Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
Embrace Distributed Work
Inclusive Work Environment

items.title: Origin Protocol (https://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Origin Protocol (https://www.originprotocol.com) is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating protocols to allow buyers and sellers of fractional usage assets and services (think Airbnb, Getaround, Fiverr, Taskrabbit) to transact without paying middlemen 20-30%. We're excited by the opportunity to promote free and transparent commerce and redistribute value to the contributors to the network instead of just the founders and VCs. We believe the open source protocols we're developing could ultimately replace dozens of existing multimillion or multibillion dollar businesses.

We're experienced founders who have built and sold multiple businesses in the past. Origin is the most ambitious idea we've tackled to date (hopefully on the right side of crazy). We currently have a working MVP built on Ethereum and IPFS. We're looking for all sorts of people to join our team, whether you code in react, python or solidity. We're a distributed team, 100% open-source and open to remote.

We're backed by well known investors like Pantera Capital, Foundation Capital, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian and many more. (https://medium.com/originprotocol/announcing-origin-protocol...)

You'll get the chance to work alongside engineering legends like Yu Pan who was part of the founding team of PayPal and the 1st engineer at YouTube. (https://medium.com/originprotocol/welcoming-yu-pan-to-the-or...)

Ping us at founders@originprotocol.com if you're interested, or better yet, join our public Discord group and start engaging with our distributed engineering team there (http://www.originprotocol.com/discord).

items.title: Full Time: Engineering Manager, Vault (vaultproject.io) at HashiCorp in Remote (USA/CAN)
items.content:
Note for GitHub jobs: This manager works with the team building https://github.com/hashicorp/vault, among other things.

Our Organization

At HashiCorp, we value top-notch collaboration and communication skills, both among internal teams and in how we interact with our users. We take care to balance and be responsive to the needs of our open source community as well as our enterprise level customers.

Engineering at HashiCorp is largely a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.

Our Products

We build Consul, Nomad, Vault, Terraform, Vagrant, and Packer. Alongside of that, we deploy enterprise products for each in a variety of different ways: licensed and unlicensed binaries, appliances to public cloud platforms, and hosted SaaS platforms. Our products help organizations of all sizes run any infrastructure for any application.

This Position

This is an engineering management role focused on our Vault product line, managing the Vault engineering team and overall product delivery. Our Vault engineering team is working to provide a fantastic and broadly used secrets tool for businesses and individuals handling all sizes and types of infrastructure. Our Vault customer base is growing rapidly and Vault is foundational for them to secure their applications. The highly technical team also provides development support and guidance to external vendor development teams and the entire Vault community across a range of technologies.

HashiCorp views management and technical leadership as two tracks, with a highly technical background being a requirement for both. This role is uniquely technical given the nature of the product, it’s criticality in securing businesses and interaction with strategic partners and vendors. Given this unique situation, it is expected that applicants would be comfortable playing a mix of roles. In order of priority, this would include management and coaching, advocacy for the team and with technical partners, and individual contribution.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Support the career growth for individuals on a team building and contributing to Vault in a busy open source community
  • Work with some of the largest infrastructure providers to support strategic relationships with HashiCorp
  • Contribute to our growing engineering management team and culture
  • Hire within the US, UK, Canada, and Europe to grow your team
  • Ensure the on-time release of well tested and reliable code used to secure mission critical services
  • Manage a team of subject matter experts with unique and individual expertise in security

You may be a good fit for our team if you have:

  • An interest in building a support structure for engineers to help them succeed at their job
  • Models and supports a positive and healthy work life balance
  • A strong and nimble set of technical skills across technologies the team interacts with, such as commonly used security technologies
  • An interest in a management career track in a technical context
  • Great communication skills for working across the organization, capable of building strong relationships with peers and leadership
  • You have experience operating and maintaining production systems in a Linux and public cloud environment
  • You have experience managing a remote distributed team of reasonable size

In your cover letter, please describe why you're interested in working at HashiCorp, and on the Vault team in particular.

At HashiCorp, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. If you are on the fence about whether you would be successful working with us, please apply anyway!

items.content:
Engineering Manager

Posted Apr 30

Logikcull
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
logikcull.com
View all Logikcull jobs →

Why we do what we do:
Logikcull’s mission is to democratize discovery. The costs and risks associated with complex data projects like e-discovery, responding to FOIA requests, and conducting internal investigations are skyrocketing as the amount of data increases. Logikcull is transforming these tasks so they can be completed in minutes, by anyone, anywhere. As a result, our customers--modern legal teams from solo attorneys to massive law firms, Fortune 500 companies, and leading non-profit organizations -- can find and use important information quickly so they can focus on their important work, like pursuing a better democracy or saving the Earth.    

Who we are:
Logikcull.com is instant discovery for modern legal teams. Its secure, cloud-based solution helps law firms and organizations of all sizes solve the expensive, complex, and risky challenges associated with eDiscovery, internal investigations, and open records response. With Logikcull, you can start a discovery project in five seconds, from anywhere at any time on any device.

What we need:
After a year of rapid growth, we are looking to bring on a new Engineering Manager to help support our distributed engineering team while providing guidance and mentorship. During the past year, our engineering team doubled in size, we saw 5X growth in the amount of data that we process and and our customer base grew by 10X. We are looking for someone who can help us to ensure that our engineers continue to have a great experience and are able to keep delivering the same high quality code. You will also help to plan and coordinate major projects for the team, set goals, and remove obstacles along the way. We have several exciting new projects and lofty goals on our strategic roadmap and we know that the team will need additional support to get us there. You will also help recruit new team members and create a world class onboarding and ongoing employee experience for them. You will get to work cross functionally across different departments, meet with customers to learn their pain points and exemplify our values.  

What you'll be doing:

  • Conduct 1:1’s, providing mentorship and feedback of current team members, making sure they have what they need to be successful
  • Partner with Talent team to attract, retain, and grow world class talent
  • Collaborate with Design and Product teams to create a clear roadmap to clarify priorities for your engineering team
  • Monitor and communicate progress to stakeholders and make adjustments to scope as needed
  • Provide context for engineers and help them to understand the “why”
  • Assist engineers with breaking down large problems into small ones setting goals, and forming plans for how achieve them
  • Remove any obstacles for your team and maintain blocks of uninterrupted time to help them to maintain a state of flow
  • Assisting with Code Reviews on occasion
  • Collaborate and coordinate about plans with other engineering managers

What we need from you:

  • Understanding of and appreciation of servant leader model of leadership
  • Desire to practice and improve the craft of management
  • While this is not primarily a coding a position, a deep understanding and appreciation of Ruby on Rails, Javascript, and scalable web applications will go a long way towards helping you to be successful
  • 3-5 years experience working on and managing distributed teams
  • Ability to both inspire engineers and to hold them accountable for excellence
  • A love of helping customers to solve problems
  • Experience managing multiple cross-functional agile teams
Want to know more about what we do at Logikcull? Check this out!

Apply for this position

Apply Here: https://jobs.lever.co/logikcull/b596472e-56bc-4ad4-9d8f-541c55bbf3dd?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WeWorkRemotely

JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Bonsai; 75-100 employees; 75-100% remote;

We're looking for a passionate growth manager with experience building and scaling growth & marketing projects from scratch.

As an early-stage startup, we're striving to build sustainable growth channels and we believe that the best growth teams are the ones that constantly experiment, iterrates and build processes to scale their work. As a result we're looking for someone who loves experimenting and building processes with huge impact with a clear obsession for data and results.

# Your role

- Oversee all our growth channels and be responsible for our acquisition metrics (number of sessions, conversion rates, number of signups)
- Discover and experiment with new growth channels. This can incude
- Testing an infuencer program
- Experimenting with co-branded marketing projects
- Trying new ads format
- Build processes to structure & scale our most successful growth channels
- Build and lead the marketing team as we grow
- Commit on and follow our growth metrics closely

# Your skills

- 2+ years of marketing/product experience
- Fast learner with a growth & scrappy mindset
- Obsessed about data with strong analytical skills
- Comfortable with HTML and CSS
- Experience working in a remote setup
- Experience working with early stage companies

# Details

- This is a remote position
- Compensation will be based on the experience

# About Bonsai

Bonsai is a Y-Combinator startup with a mission to make freelancing as secure as a full time job. We're building the first all-in-one software for freelancers to help them build, grow and manage their business with tools ranging from contracts to invoicing and accounting.

We are a fully-remote team of 8 that enjoys working together and taking on new challenges. We are backed by the best investors in the world including Y Combinator, Matrix Partners and Index Ventures.

MedicSpot is one of the UK's most innovative digital healthcare companies and we are now looking to hire an excellent individual who can join our team and help us grow even more.

Job Role: Operations Executive
Location: Central London or UK-Based
Hours Per Week: 27-45 hours (including weekends)

MedicSpot is pushing the boundaries of how patients see GPs in the UK and we are now looking for an exceptional team member to grow with us. We are strongly focused on providing convenient, accessible, and safe healthcare for everyone and applicants must share our vision.


Your Main Responsibilities:
– Receiving incoming calls from patients and explaining our service
– Liaising with our doctors to ensure that patients’ needs are met
– Be the first line of support for patients through phone, email, and chat
– Communicating effectively with our clinics ensuring that patients are seen quickly and promptly
– Administrative support for our marketing and business development teams

Who Are We Looking For?
– Be a true team player and willing to go the extra mile for your team members and patients
– Be willing and eager to learn and grow professionally
– Be tech-savvy and computer literate
– Be able to multi-task and prioritise effectively
– Have first-rate customer service skills including great spoken and written communication
– Have heaps of internal motivation
– Wanting to truly make a difference in the way healthcare is delivered
– Experience of working in a healthcare setting is preferred

This job can be done remotely from your own home or you can work from our Central London office. We are open between 9am and 6pm, 7 days a week and you will also be expected to work on weekends. Rota details can be discussed at a later stage. No 2 days will be the same – we can guarantee that.

This is a great opportunity for the right candidate to join a rapidly growing company who is revolutionising primary healthcare.

No agencies or recruiters for this job advert please – we would like to hear directly from interested candidates.

items.title: Project Manager/Product Owner at Eezy (Bowling Green, KY)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Design, Graphic Design, Photography
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We’re looking for a technically minded Product Owner with 5+ years of experience to join our team. You’ll manage the workflow from end-to-end for a variety of features, tasks and applications from inception to launch. You’ll be collaborating with the stakeholders and the development team while ensuring they receive clear direction regarding their tasks and priorities.

This role is for someone who has an aptitude for developing and maintaining project plans, monitoring the quality and timeliness of all deliverables, assigning staff resources, and ensuring adherence to project timelines and budgets. If complex or unusual technical problems arise, you will actively use your knowledge and experience to guide the team.

This is a full-time position. We are open to the possibility of remote, but ideally we would like you to be working in our corporate headquarters in Bowling Green, KY if possible.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Help define, facilitate and continuously optimize the team’s development process using Scrum and Kanban methodologies.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and operational teams to identify project requirements and and keep them updated on the status throughout the development cycle.
  • Help the team resolve issues before they cause schedule delays, and discuss them with stakeholders to clear blockers.
  • Ensure tickets are written according to the project requirements requested from the stakeholder and has well documented and acceptance criteria.
  • Act as our historian by helping us keep our internal documentation up to date with an accurate picture of what has happened and what’s to come.
  • Keep our path to the future free of debris: as our product backlogs change, work with the Product Manager to keep our product backlog relevant.

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Product Owner in the software (Saas) industry.
  • Experience helping multiple teams optimize and adapt their development process to succeed for different personalities and needs.
  • A deep understanding of the entire lifecycle of the engineering and development process.
  • Excellent communications skills. You can weigh tradeoffs and have discussions with developers on the nuances of complex engineering systems in order to push the project forward.
  • An ability to meet commitments, build consensus, negotiate resolutions, and garner respect from other team members. You say what you’ll do, and do what you say. You hold your team to this standard and don’t let details slip.
  • Experience with different software development methodologies including Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.
  • Familiarity with tools that can help our team move quickly and make informed decisions: Trello, Jira, Pivotal Tracker, etc.
  • Strong attention to detail, combined with ability to see and explain the big picture.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity, change, and shifting priorities.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Passion for maintaining a sustainable software development process where Product, Design, Engineering all work together in harmonious bliss.
  • Excellent leadership skills. You’re optimistic but realistic. You push the pace. You take the blame and pass on praise.
  • Experience effectively working with remote team members and business partners.

How to apply:
Send us a cover letter and your resume explaining why you’d be great for the job. We value your unique talents and point of view, so feel free to tell us what you are all about. We also need to know what your favorite food is so let us know!

About Eezy

We’re a rapidly growing tech-focused company with a disruptive business model and an entrepreneurial environment that can allow you to thrive. We're on a mission to make the world a more beautiful place by allowing digital design assets to be more accessible to everyone. Millions of designers visit our network of websites each month to download stock vectors, videos, photos, and other types of design assets. We put emphasis on our G.A.R.D.E.N. core values because after all, we are in this together!

Benefits

Work Remote
Flexible Work Hours
Good People
Additional Perks

items.title: Cloud Solutions Executive - Remote
items.content:
Cloud Solutions Executive - Remote - Jobmote

Cloud Solutions Executive - Remote

IT Company

Job Description

The Business Solutions Cloud Sales Executive would focus the majority of their prospecting and sales activities on companies and opportunities that would benefit from phoenixNAP Cloud Services. This sales professional will be the most experienced team member on virtualized computing products, storage and distributed applications.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

• Prospect and identify opportunities focused around phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions.

• Educate and assist prospects and understanding phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions and how they will integrate into the prospects current environment and future IT plans.

• Work with Sales Engineering to make sure prospects specific needs regarding cloud environments are met and optimized with phoenixNAP Cloud Solutions products.

• Provide prospects with detailed quotes regarding cloud opportunities and work with sales engineering to make sure clients' specific needs are being addressed.

• Follow up with any cloud opportunities that have been presented by the Sales Executive on a timely and consistent basis.

• Find and identify other sales opportunities around phoenixNAP products including Colocation, Hardware as a Service (HaaS), Bandwidth, Backup, DRaaS and other phoenixNAP products.

• Use Salesforce CRM software to set up prospects and leads, quote specific phoenixNAP products and follow up with any and all opportunities.

• Work with Channel Partners on large or complex phoenixNAP cloud opportunities to evaluate prospect needs, produce and provide quotes and work with Channel Partner on any communications with prospects.

• Educate specific channel partners on phoenixNAP cloud products including how to identify opportunities, provide education to prospects and partners regarding cloud products and offer case studies and best use practices regarding products.

• Work with Sales Leadership at phoenixNAP on state of pipeline, opportunities and other sales information.

• Provide detailed reports at the request of the sales director regarding leads, opportunities and active pipeline probability.

• Provide assistance upon request to other members of the Business Solutions sales team regarding phoenixNAP cloud products when time allows.

• Understand the marketplace and continually review competitive products and offerings and work with the Vice President of Products regarding the phoenixNAP product mix.

Physical Requirements

• Ability to sit for long periods of time.

• Ability to type at a speed of at least 60 words per minute.

• Ability to use basic Microsoft Office Suite software.

• Ability to walk or stand for long periods of time at tradeshows.

Attendance Requirements

• This is a full time position. Employee is expected to work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

• The schedule is generally Monday - Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

• Some travel to industry trade show may be required that will include overnight stays outside of the Phoenix marketplace.

• Sales Director will provide expected work hours and travel schedules.

Qualifications

• 5 - 7 years of business to business sales experience.

• 3 - 5 years of IT focused sales experience.

• Detailed training or experience with virtualization applications including VMWare, Citrix and open source solutions.

• Experience or training with Microsoft Office applications including Work, Excel & Power Point.

• Team focused attitude and a willingness to help other team members with technical information. regarding cloud and virtualization phoenixNAP products.

• Past experience or a detailed working understanding of SalesForce CRM software.

• Strong ability to manage their own time and schedule.

• Ability to maintain a opportunity pipeline and complete all sales process requirements.

• Ability to move prospects forward in the buying process and close opportunities.

• Strong work ethic focused on producing daily and weekly results.

• Understanding of individual prospecting including telephone, e-mail and social media skills.

• Excellent verbal communication skills.

• Excellent telephone communication and prospecting skills.

• A team focused attitude.

Compensation Includes

• FLSA: Exempt
• Medical Insurance
• Dental Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• $50,000 Life Insurance
• 401k

• Paid Time Off
• Discounted gym membership
• Company sponsored outings

Project Manager (Virtual, US Only)

Posted Apr 27

Cornershop Creative
Headquarters: Olney, MD
http://cornershopcreative.com
View all Cornershop Creative jobs →

Are you a technically-inclined project manager? Do you explore the latest features in Basecamp, Asana, Smartsheet, and/or Jira for fun; or organize your personal life in spreadsheets? Then have we got a job for you!

We’re seeking an awesome person to join our distributed, fourteen-member team as a Project Manager.

The core responsibility for this position will be to manage web design and development projects to  ensure our clients get the best possible service on time and within budget. This position will be responsible for managing multiple projects at once and leading day-to-day communications with clients, so we’re looking for an organized, detail-oriented, self-starting, multi-tasking person. You may also be on the frontlines of our support operation, helping our maintenance and retainer clients continue their smooth sailing after initial launch, so the ability to keep your cool when others are freaking out is key.

Since we are a WordPress-focused web agency, our ideal candidate will have at least some working knowledge of how the Internet works and of WordPress administration. Some knowledge of HTML, CSS, web design and UX standards would also be helpful, though actual developer skills are not expected: you won’t be required to write code.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain amazing relationships with inspiring nonprofit clients, many of them nontechnical
  • Oversee multiple web projects to ensure they are completed to spec and delivered on time
  • Work with clients, designers and developers to thoroughly document and communicate functional specs and ensure work is completed
  • Schedule and lead meetings with clients and Cornershop team members
  • Monitor incoming support requests and triage, resolving or assigning to other team members as necessary
Skills/Knowledge

  • Insanely detail oriented (enough that your friends may secretly hate you for it)
  • Incredibly organized (they might mock you for this too)
  • Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Experienced and enthusiastic juggler (literally would be cool, but we’re speaking metaphorically here)
  • Ability to keep your cool when others are freaking out
  • Proven track record of successful project management
  • Passionate about progressive causes
  • Knowledge of best practices in web design and development
  • Familiarity with WordPress
  • Familiarity with common nonprofit solutions, such as Luminate Online, Salsa Labs, Engaging Networks, Salesforce, and/or other similar platforms
  • Ability to remain cheerful, calm, and organized even though the *$%@ conference line isn’t working for everyone AGAIN
Awesome but Totally Not Required

  • Basic knowledge of HTML5, Sass, JS, and/or PHP
  • Some web design skills and Photoshop/Sketch experience
  • Previous experience working successfully from home as part of a remote team
  • Previous experience working for a creative agency
Cornershop Creative is an award-winning online services agency committed to listening carefully to our non-profit and small business clients and helping them achieve their goals. Our designs are beautiful, and our websites are creative and innovative. Learn more about us at https://cornershopcreative.com/.

Salary Range: Approximately $50,000-$70,000, though we are flexible based on applicant experience

Apply for this position

To apply, visit https://cornershopcreative.com/apply/ U.S. Applicants only!Cornershop is an equal opportunity employer.

items.title: Business Development Manager - HR Tech Startup
items.content:
Altroo is a HR tech start-up company in the charity sector which aims to improve the hiring process through our automated hiring platform. You can view our website here: https://www.altroo.jobs/.

We use a blend of tech and human curation to match charities with candidates on our hiring platform. It’s great for charities as tech improves the vetting process and it’s more efficient which means our fees are reasonable. It’s also great for candidates as we reverse the hiring process so that charities apply to interview candidates, not the other way around.

Since launching in January, we’re already working with lots of great charities and fantastic candidates actively looking on the platform. The response to the platform on both sides has been incredibly exciting!

We need a BD Manager to come on board at this early stage to help us take advantage of this fantastic opportunity and revolutionise the charity recruitment industry.

This is a great opportunity for the right candidate to join a young & fun start up and work with a small and motivated team. We are building a revolutionary product and you’ll be a key member of the team to make this happen!

Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be a team player but primarily take a lead role on business development, sourcing and vetting candidates. Ultimately, there is a great opportunity to take on a more managerial role as the business grows which will involve you being involved in the recruitment for and management of business development associates.

*Job Responsibilities:*

*Business Development*

* Network to identify new business opportunities through utilising our network, developing your own network and market experience
* Have an active client facing role and manage specific key accounts
* Ensure each recruitment assignment is delivered to budget and to client expectation
* Effectively demonstrate “best practices” and promote brand awareness
* Create and communicate business pipeline to the Managing Director
* Scope to build and manage a team of business development associates
* Meet and exceed KPIs and revenue targets

*Candidate Sourcing*

* Co-manage sourcing and vetting of candidates
* Build up a network of candidates in the fundraising sector
* Continuously sign up candidates on the Altroo platform
* Support candidates through the application process and act as an intermediary with the charities
* Meet and exceed KPIs

*Marketing*

* Assist with social media and advertising campaigns
* Draft blogs and marketing emails
* Assist with event organisation

*Skills & Competencies:*

* Strong commercial awareness
* Account management skills
* Excellent communication skills – oral and written
* Attention to detail in all aspects for work
* Creative thinking
* Strong team player
* Ability to analyse and report accurately
* Excellent project management skills

*Person Specification:*

* Recruitment/account management experience with charity exposure (preferred)
* A entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to work across many disciplines in the business.
* Drive and desire to become an integral part of a growing start-up
* Experience working to and exceeding targets.
* KPI’s will be set and managed on a monthly and quarterly basis

*Job Types: Full-time, Commission, Permanent*

items.content:
Director of Operations at Dataquest

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$80K–$120K
0.3%–0.6%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

At Dataquest, we teach data science to a community of hundreds of thousands of students around the world. We help students deeply learn concepts, build projects, work together, and gain the confidence they need to start new careers. You can read more about our philosophy at http://bit.ly/2u9MZfK , and read what students think at http://bit.ly/2DGmCxp .

We're bootstrapped, and we've been growing revenue 2-3x a year since we launched in 2015. Our remote team has grown from 1 to 13 in that time, and we expect our team size to be between 20 and 25 by the end of the year.

To grow revenue without investment, you have to be laser focused and able to ruthlessly prioritize. You have to look at metrics constantly, and be able to understand how they relate to the actual student experience. There's not much margin for error, and there's no extra cushion to fall back on. On the other hand, you have control, and can do what's best for the students at all times.

To make a remote team work effectively, you have to be extremely good at communication. You have to be able to allow your team to take ownership of what they're building, and own the implementation, while still being guided by high level student context and metrics.

We're looking for a Director of Operations who can help us keep growing revenue quickly while maintaining our remote culture of mostly autonomous work. We want someone who can help us communicate, prioritize, and build more efficiently. Success in this role is making everyone else on the team 20-30% more efficient.

This mostly means that you'll help us:

* Ensure that everyone on our team has the same understanding of our students
* Prioritize what to work on, and what to drop
* Identify metrics to use to guide everyone's work
* Identify processes that could be improved, and test the improvements
* Communicate the current state of all areas of the company and any blockers to team members

How this role looks exactly will depend on your skills and interests—you'll have a lot of autonomy to help shape a growing education company.

In order to support our fast growth and take on that autonomy, you'll have had experience quickly scaling teams and/or revenue in startup environments.

We think that someone who is a good fit for this role will be:

* Able to ruthlessly prioritize against metrics
* Extremely data-driven and analytical (we are, after all, a data science company)
* Good at setting goals and creating accountability in others
* Able to understand the core student-facing value of a new feature
* Willing to put in the time to understand our students deeply

Working at Dataquest gives you the chance to work with a mission-focused, motivated, team that's tackling an important problem.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
About Result Reward-
Pay on Performance Sales & Marketing Agency. The results we provide are Leads. Meetings. Sales.

For most companies, sales and marketing are the key drivers for growth. You can now work for the only agency to offer such a wide range of services which are solely geared towards driving performance on a pay on results model.

Telesales
Our salespeople are highly experienced & trained to provide high-quality results for companies who need a consultative selling approach for their often complex solutions.

Pay on Performance Telesales services include Lead Generation, Appointment Setting, Sales.


Marketing
We provide performance-related marketing solutions for companies who are looking for tangible ways to increase the revenue generated from their marketing channels.

Pay on Performance Marketing Services Include SEO, Paid Search, Email, Affiliate Marketing, Amazon Marketplace & Content syndication.


Role Overview-
This is an ideal opportunity to work within a small but ambitious company where fast learners and high achievers will advance to leading positions.

As a lead gen company, we generate our own warm and hot leads so the majority of your time will be spent speaking with people who are already interested in our services.

Salary: Home-based commision only role, with an OTE of £60,000. You will be paid on each lead which converts into a sale and paid higher commision for all deals you convert yourself.

This is a full-time role and but candidates looking for flexible working hours will be considered.

As a world-class sales training provider, you have the opportunity to join our great sales training program which will provide you with everything you need to turn into a top salesperson and be one of the highest earners in any sales team.

The Role

You should be expected to:
-Demonstrate strong product knowledge and ability to articulate our value proposition
-Regularly source new leads through Internet, emails, calls and social platforms
-Be confident and display a good manner on the phone
-Be self-sufficient, organised and able to manage own workload
-Be articulate in all methods of communication
-Follow up on enquiries to qualify that they are the right type of company we can help
-Attend and represent the brand at networking events
-Your involvement would initially be at the very first stage of the sales process. When a positive response comes back the MD will take over and you will join him on any subsequent meetings/conference calls so you can learn about the full scope of the campaign. Once you are comfortable enough, the role can advance to you being responsible for controlling the whole sales cycle.


Ideal personality and qualifications:


-The ideal candidate will have experience in one of the following – sales, business development or lead generation.
-Will also consider people who are fast learners and have a good understanding of what drives businesses commercially as excellent training will be provided
-Genuine passion for sales and lead generation and a passion for learning and creating business opportunities.
-You would be required to be pro-active with your lead generation.
-Strong written and verbal communicator
-Understanding of business

items.content:
Regional Director at Advancing Women Executives

San Francisco, San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$90K–$100K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

What does it feel like working for a company where clients every day say to you, "Thank you for doing what you do!"?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're impacting positive change in the world?
What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're stimulated intellectually by your peers while, at the same time, laughing and not taking yourself too seriously?
It feels great and this is what working at AWE feels like every day.

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a start-up with the mission to accelerate the careers of women in business to improve the global economy, by providing VP-level and above corporate executive women the opportunity to build cross-functional and cross-industry relationships in a safe, locally-based environment. AWE membership services include events, training, and executive coaching. AWE currently has memberships in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York and Chicago. AWE is based in Los Angeles, CA, but has staff in all other membership cities.

AWE is seeking a highly qualified Regional Director to join our team to be based in the Bay Area and report to the Founder and CEO. The primary responsibility of this role is to sell AWE services to VP-level and above corporate executive women for the purposes of furthering AWE’s mission and generating business revenue.

Responsibilities:
Prospecting and closing new AWE memberships in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Los Angeles;
Network and build relationships with the top influencers in corporate America, private equity, venture capital and service industries;
Lead and develop a team of sales and client relations associates;
Executing a sales methodology with an average sales cycle of 6 weeks or less;
Partner with Associate Director of Member Relations to ensure AWE leaders are active and engaged in membership through a consultative sales approach;
Sales forecasting and new business pipeline management;
Strategize about sales and client relations process and services;
Conduct Training Sessions across California locations;
Host bi-annual events and monthly dinners with AWE leaders.

Qualifications
A successful candidate will possess:

True belief in AWE’s mission to significantly improve the number of women in senior management and on board seats;
The spirit to “Be Bold” and fearless in representing AWE, even during its start-up phase;
Spirit of generosity and service;
Intellectual curiosity and drive to problem solve;
Natural ability to connect with people and to be a connector for people;
6+ years transactional sales experience with success negotiating and closing business;
Exceptional ability to immediately establish one's credibility with senior executives;
Willingness to work outside strict job description parameters, thinking creatively about how to provide the highest level of customer/member service and overall business growth;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong public speaking skills and experience presenting to large groups;
Great sense of humor;
Excellent meeting facilitation skills; ability to conduct 100% phone-based meetings;
Solid understanding of business concepts and ability to quickly learn content terrain;
Ability to diagnose prospect needs and identify relevant resources;
Ability to meet personal and team weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals;
Solid understanding of business concepts & dynamics for large national and international corporations;
Superior time management, detail orientation and organization skills;
Bachelor's Degree required, MBA preferred.

AWE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

items.content:
Why we exist

We want to inspire a generation of children to become the very best they can be through their relationships, their well-being and their own sense of purpose.

We will do this by teaching at least a million children how to communicate well, collaborate effectively, think critically, solve problems creatively and lead brilliantly so that they can shape their future and those around them. Click here to find out more from our website.



Roles & responsibilities

We are running a range of residential and non-residential Life Skills Courses for 8-12 year olds over the Summer holidays and are looking for a part-time (3 days / week with some flexibility) from ASAP until August 15th to help manage the preparation for those courses to ensure they run like clockwork. The key courses you will be focusing on are listed at the bottom of this job spec but you will be expected to help with others.

The courses focus on helping children to present themselves effectively and react positively to pressure. It will teach children to value collaboration and imagination and to develop a positive and robust approach to setbacks. The mornings include activities such as public speaking, debating, team building exercises, interview practice. The afternoons include activities such as high ropes exercises, scouts training, orienteering and Dragon Boat racing.

This opportunity will suit someone who is a proactive, self-starter with the ability to think on their feet. You must be an extremely organised, diligent “doer” who has a passion for delivering high quality results.

Working mostly by yourself but with support from the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring all aspects of the courses are in place, including but not limited to:

- Meticulously planning the course timetable with activities, transport, staffing etc all scheduled.
- Running the course training day on July 20th to ensure staff fully understand how the course will run.
- Regularly updating our Chinese Partner, Qin Li, and the Role Models Managing Director, Hugo Shephard on progress.
- Ensuring the relevant policies, insurance and other important documents are all in place.



Minimum criteria

- You must have experience of managing complex projects or events with demanding clients.
- You must be available from July 28th – August 11th to stay onsite at one of the residential venues listed below (potentially moving between the two). You won’t be accompanying the team to Istanbul.
- You must be available on Friday July 20th for the mandatory training day.
- You must be available to spend at least one of your three days / week in our offices in Battersea, SW11 5EN. The rest of the time you can work from home.
- You must be 18 years of age or older.
- You must be an EEA citizen or have the right to work in the UK.
- You must have an enhanced DBS certificate (previously called a CRB) valid within the last 3 years. If you do not, you must be willing to apply for one at a cost of approximately £58 if successful at interview stage.


Dates & locations of courses that Project Manager will focus on

- A non-residential Life Skills Course in Istanbul to a group of circa 45 Turkish children aged 8-12 from June 25th – July 6th 2018. Training date tbc.
- A residential Life Skills Course at Tonbridge School (Kent) to a group of circa 40 Chinese students aged 8-14 from July 28th – August 11th 2018. July 28th is a training day on site.
- A residential Life Skills Course at Ardingly College (Sussex) to a group of circa 73 Chinese students aged 8-14 from July 28th – August 11th 2018. July 28th is a training day on site.

In addition to the July 28th training date, the mandatory pre-course training date is Friday July 20th.


Remuneration

Pay would be £120-150 / day depending on experience.


How to apply

If you’re interested, please email your CV and a short covering email explaining why you’re perfect for the role to the application email address by Thursday May 3rd. Earlier applications encouraged. Please pass on to anyone you think might fit the bill.
